revised_title: Short-sightedness and the Factors Influencing Vision
tldr: The author, James Ware, examines short-sightedness and its prevalence in different classes of society. He discusses the role of corneal shape, the crystalline lens, and the vitreous humor in vision. Ware also explores the effects of external factors, such as the use of glasses, pupil dilation, and age, on vision and eye health.
